title.narrative: EDUCATION:MIGRATION RESPONSE

description.narrative: Migrant Children and their families have access to life saving information to support and promote their protection and healthy behaviour, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Enhance capacity of national partners and stakeholders to protect children and adolescents affected by irregular migration and to recover from trauma and violence

sector.narrative: Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Migrant Children and their families have access to life saving information to support and promote their protection and healthybehaviour

description.narrative: 2021 was a year of growth and development of;the;technical capacity of relevant stakeholders in education through;the;exchange of experiences, and through the strengthening of tools to enhance English language proficiency among;migrant and refugee children and host community children.;Despite the system-wide progress,;administrative barriers linked to the permit,;or the permit exemption remain.;As a result,;over;3,500 school-age children;remain without access to education in the national system.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022
